UNMISTAKABLE.Definition: not able to be mistaken for anything else, very distinctive

TRIALS.Definition: formal examinations or hearings of a case in a court of law

PASSERS-BY.Definition: people who happened to be going past you

CRUCIFIXES.Definition: representations of a cross with a figure of Christ on them

THE DEAD OF NIGHT.Definition: the quietest, darkest part of the night

CAPE.Definition: loose piece of clothing without sleeves that hangs from the shoulders

SHIVER.Definition: shake or tremble because of feeling frightened

MAINSTREAM.Definition: known to or followed by most people

TAKE FOR GRANTED.Definition: believe it is true without questioning it

LIVERS.Definition: large organs of the body that clean the blood

GRAVE.Definition: the place in the ground where dead people are buried

MONSTROUS.Definition: having the appearance of a monster, horrible

DIGGING UP.Definition: taking out of the ground by digging

EPIDEMICS.Definition: appearances of diseases on a large scale or among many people

CULPRIT.Definition: someone who has done something bad

DIG UP.Definition: take out of the ground by digging

GRAVES.Definition: places in the ground where dead people are buried

BRICK.Definition: a block of hard material used for building

SIGHTINGS.Definition: occasions or instances of seeing them

CHOKED.Definition: killed them by pressing their throat so that they couldn't breathe

ALLEGATIONS.Definition: statements or claims that he had done it, without giving proof

EXHUME.Definition: remove it from the ground after it had been buried

DIG IT UP.Definition: take it out of the ground

SHRINK.Definition: become smaller or reduced in extent

DUG UP.Definition: took it out of the ground

CRAZE.Definition: an interest followed by a lot of people with enthusiasm

SUPERSTITION.Definition: belief that is not based on reason or science but is connected with magic or spirits

IMPALING.Definition: pushing a sharp object through them

STAB.Definition: kill them using sharp objects, like knives etc.

DILEMMAS.Definition: situations in which it was hard to choose between two things

TROPES.Definition: ideas or phrases regularly used in similar works

MAKEOVERS.Definition: changes that make them more attractive

ASCRIBE.Definition: regard it as being caused by such things

DEMONISING.Definition: representing him as evil and threatening

PROTAGONISTS.Definition: the main characters of the episode
